name: Yuguang Michael Fang
content: Yuguang Fang's Home Page Yuguang "Michael" Fang (方玉光), PhD, ACM Fellow, IEEE Fellow, and AAAS Fellow (Google Scholar Profile) Chair Professor of Internet of Things Director, Hong Kong Jockey Club STEM Lab of Smart City Director, Wireless Intelligence and Networked Things Lab (WINET) Department of Computer Science, City University of Hong Kong 83 Tat Chee Avenue, Yeung-G7359, Hong Kong, China e-mail: my.fang@cityu.edu.hk, https://www.cs.cityu.edu.hk/~yugufang/ Attention: If you have a strong passion for doing research, this may be the right place for you. I am particularly interested in self-motivated students who are willing to spend their golden times here with this group :-). If interested, please send me your resume, transcripts, and English test score in pdf form. Experience Director, Hong Kong Jockey Club STEM Lab of Smart City, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, China, January 2023-Present. Global STEM Scholar & Chair Professor of Internet of Things, Department of Computer Science, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, China, August 2022-Present. Emeritus Distinguished Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida, August 2022-present. Distinguished Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida, July 2019-August 2022. University of Florida Foundation Preeminence Term Professorship, 2019-2022. University of Florida Research Foundation Professorship, University of Florida , 2017-2020, 2006-2009. University of Florida Term Professorship, University of Florida , 2019-2022, 2017- 2019. Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida , August 2005-June 2019 Associate Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida, August 2003-August 2005 (Also affiliated with Department of Computer & Information Science & Engineering, University of Florida). Assistant Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida, May 2000-July 2003 (Also affiliated with Department of Computer & Information Science & Engineering, University of Florida). Assistant Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, New Jersey Institute of Technology, July 1998-May 2000 (Also affiliated with Department of Computer Science & Information Systems , New Jersey Institute of Technology). Visiting Assistant Professor, Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science, The University of Texas at Dallas, May 1997-July 1998. Research Assistant, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Boston University, September 1995-May 1997. Postdoctoral Research Associate, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Boston University, June 1994-August 1995. Research Associate, Department of Systems, Control and Industrial Engineering, Case Western Reserve University, January 1994-May 1994. Teaching/Research Assistant, Department of Systems Engineering, Case Western Reserve University, September 1989-December 1993. Lecturer, Department of Mathematics and The Institute of Automation, Qufu Normal University, Shandong, P.R.China, July 1987-October 1988. Honors and Awards ACM Fellow (2022) ("For contributions to wireless networks and mobile computing"). 2019 IEEE Ad Hoc and Sensor Networks Technical Committee (AHSN) Technical Achievement Award ("For Outstanding Contributions to Medium Access Control and Security in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks and Wireless Sensor Networks")(the certificate, the plaque, news,and photos 1, 2, and 3). 2019-2020 University of Florida College of Engineering (CoE) Doctoral Dissertation Advisor/Mentoring Award. 2019 ECE Faculty Excellence Award (Research) (Photo), Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida. University of Florida Foundation Preeminence Term Professorship, 2019-2022. Distinguished Professor, University of Florida, July 2019-present. University of Florida Term Professorship, University of Florida , 2019-2022, 2017- 2019. 2018 IEEE Vehicular Technology Outstanding Service Award ("For outstanding service as the Editor-in-Chief for the IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology (2013-2017)'')(the plague and photos (Award Presentation 1, Award Presentation 2, Award Presentation 3, Photo with Drs. Lajos Hanzo and Sherman Shen, Photo with Dr. Lajos Hanzo, and Photo with Dr. Sherman Shen)). 2018 IEEE TCGCC Best Journal Paper Award, IEEE Technical Committee on Green Communications & Computing (TCGCC), for the paper "An energy-efficient strategy for secondary users in cooperative cognitive radio networks for green communications" (Jianqing Liu, Haichuan Ding, Ying Cai, Hao Yue, Yuguang Fang and Shigang Chen) in IEEE Journal on Selected Areas in Communications (vol.34, no.12, pp.3195-3207, December 2016). The award was presented at the IEEE TCGCC committee meeting at the IEEE International Conference on Communications (ICC) (Presentation Photo and Award Certificate), Kansas City, MO, May 20-24, 2018. University of Florida Research Foundation Professorship, University of Florida , 2017-2020 (Photo with Dr. John Harris and Photo with Dr. David Norton and Photo with Drs. Forrest Masters, John Harris and Jon Dobson); 2006-2009. Overseas Academic Master, School of Information and Communication Engineering, Dalian University of Technology, 2016-2018. Best Paper Award for the paper "Economic-robust session based spectrum trading in multi-hop cognitive radio networks" (X. Li, M. Pan, Y. Song, Y. Sun and Y. Fang) in Symposium on Cognitive Radio and Wireless Networks at IEEE Globecom, San Diego, California, 6-10 December, 2015. Best Paper Award for the paper "Privacy-preserving verifiable proximity test for location-based services"(G. Zhuo, Q. Jia, L. Guo, M. Li and Y. Fang) in Symposium on Communications and Information System Security at IEEE Globecom, San Diego, California, 6-10 December, 2015. AAAS Fellow (2015) ("For distinguished research and teaching contributions to the field of electrical and computer engineering, particularly for wireless network design and cybersecurity"). Some news items (University, College, and Department) 2015-2016 University of Florida College of Engineering (CoE) Doctoral Dissertation Advisor/Mentoring Award. Guest Professor, School of Electronics, Information and Electrical Engineering (SEIEE) , Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China, 2015-2018. IEEE Vehicular Technology Society Distinguished Lecturer, 2015-2019. 2015 IEEE Communications & Information Security Technical Committee (CISTC) Technical Recognition Award (for "Contributions to Security and Privacy on Wireless Networks and Mobile Computing Systems")(the plague and photos 1, 2, 3). 2014 IEEE Wireless Communications Technical Committee (WTC) Recognition Award (for "A person with a high degree of visibility and contribution in the field of `Wireless and Mobile Communications Theory, Systems, and Networks'") (the plague and photos 1, 2). IEEE Communications Society Distinguished Lecturer, 2012-2015. Guest Professor, School of Information Science and Technology , University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, China, 2012-2015. Best Paper Award for the paper "Cutting down electricity cost in internet data centers by using energy storage" (Yuanxiong Guo, Zongrui Ding, Yuguang Fang and Dapeng Wu) in Symposium on the Communications QoS, Reliability, and Modeling at IEEE Globecom'2011, Houston, TX, USA, 2011. 2011 Florida Blue Key/UF Homecoming Distinguished Faculty Award, 2011 ( the plaque and photos 1,2,3) 2010-2011 Doctoral Dissertation Advisor/Mentoring Award, University of Florida, 2011. Here is the plaque. 2010-2011 University of Florida College of Engineering (CoE) Doctoral Dissertation Advisor/Mentoring Award. 2009 College of Engineering Faculty Mentoring Award, University of Florida, 2009. Guest Chair Professor with Kumar Chair Professor Group, Tsinghua University, China, 2009-2012. JSPS Invitation Fellowship, Japan Society for the Promotion of Science, May-July 2009. IEEE Fellow (2008) (through the IEEE Communications Society) ("For contributions to wireless networks and mobile computing systems"). A small token from IEEE Communications Society. Changjiang Scholar Chair Professorship (Dalian Maritime University, Dalian, China, 2015-2018; Xidian University, Xi'an, China, 2008-2011). Guest Professor, School of Telecommunications Engineering, Xidian University, Xi'an, China, 2008-2011. NSC Visiting Researcher (Professorship sponsored by the National Research Council, Taiwan), Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering, National Taiwan University, 2007-2008. Best Paper Award for the paper "Impact of routing metrics on path capacity in multi-rate and multi-hop wireless ad hoc networks" (Hongqiang Zhai and Yuguang Fang) in the 14th IEEE International Conference on Network Protocols (ICNP), Santa Barbara, California, November 12-15, 2006. 2006-2007 University of Florida College of Engineering (CoE) Doctoral Dissertation Advisor/Mentoring Award. 2005-2006 University of Florida College of Engineering (CoE) Doctoral Dissertation Advisor/Mentoring Award. Guest Professor, The School of Computer Science & Technology, Beijing University of Posts & Telecommunications, China, 2004-2010. Guest Professor, Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Science, China, 2004-2007. The IEEE TCGN Best Paper Award for the paper "Fast Collision Resolution (FCR) MAC Algorithm for Wireless Local Area Networks" (Younggoo Kwon, Yuguang Fang and Haniph Latchman) in IEEE High-Speed Networks Symposium, IEEE Globecom'2002, Taipei, Taiwan, 2002 (given by The IEEE ComSoc Technical Committee on Gigabit Networking (TCGN)). 2004 IEEE Regional Activities Board (RAB) Section Membership Growth Award, given to IEEE Gainesville Section (Fang as the Section Chair).
